2024-2025 Shepherd University Catalog

Nursing Comprehensive, B.S.N.

Print-Friendly Page (opens a new window)
Facebook this Page (opens a new window)
Tweet this Page (opens a new window)

Vision Statement

We will be a nationally respected community of nurse leaders where passion, purpose, and experience unite to inspire health in individuals, families, communities, and populations.

 

Mission Statement

Shepherd University’s School of Nursing’s mission is to enhance the health status of the world by educating professional nurses for practice in a rapidly changing health care environment. We are dedicated to the university core values of learning, engagement, integrity, accessibility, and community.

 

Program Goals

The goals of the BSN program are to prepare a graduate who is able to:

1.  Integrate a background of liberal arts with the knowledge, skills, and values of professional nursing in order to affect the health of the patient.

2.  Practice professional nursing utilizing skills in communication, clinical judgment, patient-centered care and professionalism.

3.  Engage in teamwork with members of the intra- and inter-professional health care team promoting safe, quality, cost-effective, patient-centered care.

4.  Engage in self-care, service, lifelong learning, and continued scholarship.
 

Please note that there are specific admission requirements  for entrance into the Nursing program at Shepherd University.

Curriculum for a Comprehensive Major in Nursing

Total hours required for the degree, 120 Hours:

Specific core curriculum and nursing prerequisites, 58 Hours:

The BSN requires specific courses to satisfy some Core Curriculum Â requirements (Lab Sciences and Social Science).Â  Grades of C or better required in all prerequisite courses listed.

  • PSYC 101 - Introduction to Psychology (3 cr) Satisfies a Tier Two Social Sciences (SO)
  • SOCI 203 - General Sociology (3 cr) Satisfies a Tier Two Social Sciences (SO)
  • CHEM 125 - Chemistry for the Health Sciences (3cr) *
  • CHEM 125L - Chemistry for the Health Sciences Lab (1cr) *
  • BIOL 225 - Human Anatomy and Physiology (3 cr)
  • BIOL 227 - Human Anatomy and Physiology Lab (1 cr)
  • BIOL 226 - Human Anatomy and Physiology (3 cr)
  • BIOL 228 - Human Anatomy and Physiology Lab (1 cr)
  • BIOL 302 - Microbiology (4 cr)
  • NUTR 318 - Nutrition (3cr)
  • NURS 210 - Recovery and Life Coaching (3cr)
  • NURS 320 - Bioethics (3 cr) **
  • A college-level course in statistics
Note(s):

It is recommended that science courses be taken in order listed.

*CHEM 125/125L requires MATH 105 Â as a prerequisite.

**Any college-level ethics course can be substituted for NURS 320 .

Upper-division nursing requirements, 62 Hours:

  • NURS 330 - Patient-Centered Care: Foundations of Nursing (4cr)
  • NURS 331 - Performance Outcomes I (1 cr)
  • NURS 332 - Patient-Centered Care: Older Adult (2 cr)
  • NURS 333 - Health Assessment (3 cr)
  • NURS 334 - Pharmacotherapeutics (3 cr)
  • NURS 335 - Nursing Informatics (3cr)

  •  

  • NURS 340 - Patient Centered Care: Behavioral Health (5 cr)
  • NURS 341 - Performance Outcomes II (1 cr)
  • NURS 342 - Patient-Centered Care: Adult Health I (6 cr)
  • NURS 345 - Genetics and Genomics in Nursing (3cr)

  •    

  • NURS 430 - Patient-Centered Care: Children & Families (4 cr)
  • NURS 431 - Performance Outcomes III (1 cr)
  • NURS 432 - Patient-Centered Care: Adult Health II (6 cr)
  • NURS 438 - Patient-Centered Care: Childbearing Family (4cr)

  •  

  • NURS 442 - Patient-Centered Care: Population Health (5 cr)
  • NURS 444 - Capstone Immersion Experience (4 cr)
  • NURS 443 - Leadership (3 cr)
  • NURS 445 - NCLEX-RN Preparation (1 cr)
  • NURS 447 - Nursing Research and Evidence-Based Practice (3 cr)

R.N.-to-B.S.N. Curriculum Plan

RN to BSN Track Requirements, 30 Hours:

Â It is expected that RNs will complete the required Core Curriculum Â courses before applying to the nursing program. Please see the RN to BSN Coordinator for assistance in program planning.

  • NURS 320 - Bioethics (3 cr)
  • NURS 333 - Health Assessment (3 cr)
  • NURS 335 - Nursing Informatics (3cr)
  • NURS 345 - Genetics and Genomics in Nursing (3cr)
  • NURS 442 - Patient-Centered Care: Population Health (5 cr)
  • NURS 443 - Leadership (3 cr)
  • NURS 444 - Capstone Immersion Experience (4 cr)
  • NURS 447 - Nursing Research and Evidence-Based Practice (3 cr)
  • NURS 510 - Health Care Delivery Systems: Political, Social, and Economic Influences (3 cr)
